meanings.sent1: The king beknighted the brave warrior for his valor in battle.
meanings.sent2: The queen decided to beknight her loyal advisor for his unwavering support.
meanings.sent3: The wizard beknighted the squirrel, making it the bravest creature in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The sun beknighted the sky with its golden rays, turning it into a majestic canvas.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to beknight the young squire was filled with pomp and grandeur.

meanings.definition: To honor with the title of knight.
meanings.sent1: The nobleman beknighted his son, making him a proud member of the knighthood.
meanings.sent2: The queen beknighted the young page, granting him the privileges of a knight.
meanings.sent3: The cat beknighted the mouse, declaring it the bravest rodent in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The stars beknighted the night sky, adorning it with their shimmering light.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to beknight the loyal servant was a moment of great honor and respect.
